rooms.description: A spacious entrance hall integrated with a verandah overlooking the garden, aligning with Vastu for auspicious beginnings. Traditional Kerala-style carved wooden doors and tiled floors are used.
An open-plan living room with traditional Kerala motifs; ample natural light through large windows, facilitating Vastu principles for prosperity and energy flow.
Dining area adjoining the living room. Features a traditional Kerala-style dining table with carved wood detailing and locally sourced stone flooring.
A functional yet traditionally styled kitchen with modern amenities integrated discreetly. Vastu recommendations for south-east placement are considered.
Multi-purpose family room that doubles as a guest area and workspace, incorporating Kerala woodwork and murals. The room is oriented to the north for beneficial energy flows.
A well-lit bathroom with water features to maintain positive energy flow as per Vastu. Traditional Kerala aesthetics and stone tiles are used.
Storage area integrated within the living room space, featuring built-in cabinets designed with traditional motifs.
An open patio space that connects to a large garden. Emphasizes natural ventilation and aligns with Vastu principles for harmony with nature.

openings.description: A traditional Kerala-style carved wooden door serving as the main entrance. Placed in the auspicious east-west axis.
Large windows on the back wall providing ample light and garden views; designed with louvered shutters to ensure privacy while letting in natural light.
Side windows arranged symmetrically to adhere to Vastu principles of balanced energy flow throughout the studio apartment.
